meanings.definition: To twist or turn in a winding or spiral motion.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys wisting her hair into a braid.
meanings.sent2: The road was wisting through the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept wisting around its owner's legs playfully.
meanings.sent4: The tornado was wisting through the town, leaving destruction in its path.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's body was wisting gracefully to the music.

meanings.definition: To distort or misrepresent facts or information.
meanings.sent1: He was wisting the truth to make himself look better.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid was wisting the celebrity's words to create a scandal.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was wisting the news in a hilarious way.
meanings.sent4: Her reflection in the funhouse mirror was wisting her features into a funny shape.
meanings.sent5: The artist was wisting reality in his abstract paintings.

meanings.definition: To change direction suddenly or unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: The car wisted to avoid hitting the deer on the road.
meanings.sent2: The plot of the movie wisted in a surprising twist.
meanings.sent3: The conversation wisted from serious to silly topics.
meanings.sent4: His mood wisted from happy to sad in a matter of minutes.
meanings.sent5: The river wisted through the valley, creating a scenic view.
